title: Ydre Nørrebro
text:
Ydre Nørrebro (<a href="English%20language">English</a>: Outer Nørrebro) is an area in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>, <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>. It is the part of the district of <a href="N%C3%B8rrebro">Nørrebro</a> located farthest from the <a href="Indre%20By">City Centre</a>. It covers an area of 2.10 km², has a population of 41,497 and a population density of 19,733 per km², making it the most densely populated district in Copenhagen and all of Denmark. Approximately 25% of the inhabitants are immigrants, in some areas the immigrants population is 50%. Many shops are run by <a href="Middle%20Eastern">Middle Eastern</a> and <a href="South%20Asian">South Asian</a> immigrants which gives the area a very multi-ethnic atmosphere.
Neighboring city districts are as follows:
<a href="Colloquialism">Colloquially</a>, the Ydre Nørrebro and the Indre Nørrebro are commonly referred to as <a href="N%C3%B8rrebro">Nørrebro</a>.
